chief_complaint: Chest pain for the past 3 hours
hpi: 55-year-old male presents with substernal chest pressure that started 3 hours ago while climbing stairs at work. The pain radiates to his left arm and jaw. He rates the pain 7/10. He took two antacids without relief. He also reports mild shortness of breath and diaphoresis. He denies nausea, vomiting, or palpitations. No prior episodes like this.
pmh: Former smoker (quit 2 years ago, 20 pack-year history)

social_history.tobacco: Former smoker, quit 2 years ago, 20 pack-year history
social_history.diet: High-fat diet, minimal fruits and vegetables

ros.cardiovascular: Chest pressure, diaphoresis; denies palpitations, orthopnea, PND
ros.respiratory: Mild dyspnea on exertion; denies cough, hemoptysis

physical_exam_findings.general: Alert, anxious-appearing male in mild distress, diaphoretic
physical_exam_findings.vitals: BP 158/92, HR 96, RR 20, SpO2 96% on RA, Temp 37.0C
physical_exam_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, no murmurs, S4 gallop noted, JVP not elevated
physical_exam_findings.pulmonary: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes or crackles
physical_exam_findings.abdominal: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, normoactive bowel sounds

imaging: CXR: No acute cardiopulmonary process, mild cardiomegaly
ECG: ST depression in leads V4-V6 and lead II, no ST elevation
differential_diagnosis: NSTEMI (most likely given risk factors, troponin elevation, ECG changes)
Aortic dissection (less likely, no tearing pain or pulse differential)
Pulmonary embolism (less likely, no pleuritic pain or tachycardia out of proportion)
GERD (unlikely given ECG changes and troponin elevation)
emotional_presentation: Anxious and worried about having a heart attack like his father. Slightly irritable when asked repetitive questions. Expresses concern about missing work deadlines. Needs reassurance but does not want to appear weak.
